div.p: This case-insensitive code system http://smart.who.int/ig/smart-immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D defines the following codes:

tr.td: The current status or recommendation for a specific immunization for an client
The client is not currently eligible or scheduled for the specified immunization
The client is currently eligible and should receive the specified immunization based on the recommended schedule
The client has received the specified immunization(s) based on the recommended schedule
The specified immunization is not recommended for the client due to contraindications
Additional assessment is necessary before making a recommendation regarding the specified immunization
Specific situations or medical conditions in which it is advised or recommended to avoid or delay administering a particular vaccine
The client is known to be immunocompromised
The client is known to be severely immunocompromised
The client is undergoing immunosuppressive treatment or was exposed to immunosuppressive treatment in utero or via breastfeeding.
The client is known to be severely immunosuppressed
The client has immunodeficiency syndromes (e.g. HIV/AIDS, known or suspected congenital immunodeficiency, leukaemia, lymphoma or other malignant disease)
The client is known to have history of anaphylaxis in the past
The client is known to have severe allergic reaction
The client is experiencing HIV-related symptoms
Planning to get pregnant in the next month
The client's intention or desire is to become pregnant in the next month
The client is receiving blood or blood-related products as part of a medical treatment.
The client has a severe acute illness
The client has been diagnosed with Tuberculosis
The client has Exstrophy of urinary bladder
The client has moderate to severe fever
The client has prior history of intussusception
The client's immune system is not functioning at its typical capacity
The client has heightened sensitivity or allergic reactions to specific components found in vaccines
The client is currently taking antibiotics to treat certain infections
The current status of the individual immunization event
The immunization event was successfully carried out as intended

Immunization event record has been mistakenly created or entered into system. Recorded information is incorrect or should not have been documented, though it is possible that real-world decisions were based on it
Planned immunization event was not carried out for some reason
The reason this immunization event was not performed
Testing has shown that the client already has immunity to the agent targeted by the immunization
The client currently has a medical condition for which the vaccine is contraindicated or for which precaution is warranted
There was no supply of the product on hand to perform the service
The client or their guardian objects to receiving the vaccine
The client's caregiver refused the vaccine
The immunization event was not carried out for an unspecified reason
Client allergy to vaccine or component
The immunization event was not carried out because of client allergy to vaccine or component
The immunization event was not carried out because the client is immunocompromised
The immunization event was not carried out due a chronic illness or condition of the client
The immunization event was not carried out due to an acute illness present in the client
The immunization event was not carried out due to the client having had the disease
Immunization not carried out for other reasons
The immunization event was not carried out for other reasons
The brand or trade name used to refer to the vaccine received
Uses a living but weakened version of the virus or one that’s very similar
Vaccine type/category that was administered or was to be administered. Any vaccine code available in the IMMZ.Z Vaccine Library list of codes applies in this data element
Represents the visit/encounter date, which is the date and time when the vaccine was administered to the client
The service delivery country where the vaccine administration occurred
The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred
The manufacturer of the vaccine product
Batch number or lot number of vaccine
Name of the market authorization holder of the vaccine received. If market authorization holder is unknown, vaccine manufacturer is REQUIRED
The expiration date of the vaccine
The quantity of vaccine product that was administered

The person, organization, or role of the entity that performed the act of giving the vaccine to the client. The implementing system can choose to populate this field using data from a health worker registry or health facility registry
The date and time of the client's contact
The ANC contact or visit number
Client education and counselling on immunization
Providing information, guidance, and support to client or caretakers (such as parents or legal guardians) regarding immunization practices
Counselling on functions of the immunological system
Explaining to the client or caregiver how the vaccines work by triggering the body to produce an immune response
Advising about functions of the immunological system
Explaining to the client or caregiver how the vaccines work by triggering the body to produce an immune response
Public health interventions to improve general and accurate understanding and impacts of vaccines, and their role in preventing various diseases
Public health interventions to improve general and accurate understanding and impacts of vaccines, and their role in preventing various diseases
Awareness raising to influence immunization behaviours
Public health interventions to improve general and accurate understanding and impacts of vaccines, and their role in preventing various diseases
Indicates observation of an adverse event/ reaction
The manifestation of the reaction (e.g. infected abscess, swelling, rash, hives, diarrhea, etc.) which was observed after administering the vaccine
The client's reaction manifested in severe local reaction
The client's reaction manifested in seizures
The client's reaction manifested in an abscess
The client's reaction manifested in sepsis
The client's reaction manifested in encephalopathy
The client's reaction manifested in toxic shock syndrome
The client's reaction manifested in anaphylaxis
The client's reaction manifested as a fever
The client's reaction manifested in another way
If the event resulted in a reaction, the type of reaction
The reaction resulted in a mild or minor response and did not pose a significant threat to client's health
The reaction resulted in the client's death
The reaction threatened the client's life
The reaction resulted in a disability
The reaction resulted in a hospitalization
The reaction was a congenital anomaly or birth defect
There was another important reaction or medical event
The outcome of the reaction (e.g. death, recovered, recovering)
The adverse event resulted in the client's death
The client is recovered with sequelae as a consequence of the reaction/vaccination
The client's reaction outcome is unknown
Vaccine dose number including dose number within series
The recommended number of doses for immunity according to the national protocol (which may be based on product, age, etc)
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is typhoid
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is influenza
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is measles
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is pertussis
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is mumps
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is varicella
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is viral hepatitis A
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is tuberculosis
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is viral hepatitis B
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is Haemophilus influenzae type B (Hib)
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is tetanus
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is rotavirus
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is japanese encephalitis
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is poliomyelitis
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is diphtheria
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is pneumococcal
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is rubella
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is dengue
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is rabies
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is meningococcal
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is cholera
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is Tick-Borne encephalitis
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is yellow fever
The vaccine preventable disease being targeted is coronovirus disease (COVID-19)
Date on which the next vaccination should be administered, if a next dose is required
Date the patient is to return for next vaccination
Date when follow-up is recommended based on vaccination schedule
Indicates if a digital certificate is required
The authority or authorized organization that issued the vaccination certificate
Unique identifier used to associate the immunization event represented in a paper vaccination card to its digital representation(s)
Date in which the certificate for an immunization event became valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
Last date in which the certificate for an immunization event is valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
Version of the core data set and HL7 Fast Health Interoperability Resrouces (FHIR) Implementation Guide that the certificate is using

definition.value: The current status or recommendation for a specific immunization for an client
The client is not currently eligible or scheduled for the specified immunization
The client is currently eligible and should receive the specified immunization based on the recommended schedule
The client has received the specified immunization(s) based on the recommended schedule
The specified immunization is not recommended for the client due to contraindications
Additional assessment is necessary before making a recommendation regarding the specified immunization
Specific situations or medical conditions in which it is advised or recommended to avoid or delay administering a particular vaccine
The client is currently pregnant
The client is known to be immunocompromised
The client is known to be severely immunocompromised
The client is undergoing immunosuppressive treatment or was exposed to immunosuppressive treatment in utero or via breastfeeding.
The client is known to be severely immunosuppressed
The client has immunodeficiency syndromes (e.g. HIV/AIDS, known or suspected congenital immunodeficiency, leukaemia, lymphoma or other malignant disease)
The client is known to have history of anaphylaxis in the past
The client is known to have severe allergic reaction
The client is experiencing HIV-related symptoms

definition.value: The client's intention or desire is to become pregnant in the next month
The client is receiving blood or blood-related products as part of a medical treatment.
The client has a severe acute illness
The client has been diagnosed with Tuberculosis
The client is currently breastfeeding
The client has Spina bifida
The client has Exstrophy of urinary bladder
The client has acute gastroenteritis
The client has moderate to severe fever
The client has prior history of intussusception

The client is currently taking antibiotics to treat certain infections

display.value: Client allergy to vaccine or component

The immunization event was not carried out because the client is immunocompromised

The immunization event was not carried out due to an acute illness present in the client
The immunization event was not carried out due to the client having had the disease

display.value: Immunization not carried out for other reasons

definition.value: The immunization event was not carried out for other reasons

Name of the market authorization holder of the vaccine received. If market authorization holder is unknown, vaccine manufacturer is REQUIRED
The expiration date of the vaccine

The person, organization, or role of the entity that performed the act of giving the vaccine to the client. The implementing system can choose to populate this field using data from a health worker registry or health facility registry
The date and time of the client's contact
The ANC contact or visit number
Client's pregnancy status

Indicates observation of an adverse event/ reaction
When adverse event/ reaction started
The manifestation of the reaction (e.g. infected abscess, swelling, rash, hives, diarrhea, etc.) which was observed after administering the vaccine
The client's reaction manifested in severe local reaction
The client's reaction manifested in seizures

The client's reaction manifested in encephalopathy

The reaction resulted in the client's death
The reaction threatened the client's life
The reaction resulted in a disability
The reaction resulted in a hospitalization
The reaction was a congenital anomaly or birth defect
There was another important reaction or medical event

The adverse event resulted in the client's death
The client fully recovered
The client is recovered with sequelae as a consequence of the reaction/vaccination
The client is recovering
The client has not recovered
The client's reaction outcome is unknown

The recommended number of doses for immunity according to the national protocol (which may be based on product, age, etc)
